intro: Epidendrum pusillum, commonly known as the miniature orchid, is a small epiphytic orchid native to Central and South America. It typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant has thin, wiry stems and produces small, pale green or yellowish flowers. Its leaves are narrow and革质 (leathery), which helps it retain moisture in its natural habitat. Epidendrum pusillum is prized by orchid enthusiasts for its compact size and delicate floral display.
